item.title: The road is sunken outside near 23 Credon Road, 22nd January
item.description:
The road appears to have been previously repaired before but the damage has gotten worse over the last few months & it’s sinking even more. The water is pooling there & not draining. An Uber driver damaged his car door due to the unevenness of the road which . This needs to be repaired asap.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Credon Road, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegal scaffolding, 22nd January
item.description:
This company is setting up scaffolding blocking the pavement and with their vehicle blocking the bus stop. When challenged, they said they needed to park and the bus was fine. It is not, there is no space for the bus to align with the pavement and it had to stop IN the road for passengers to board.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 132, Middle Lane, Hornsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A bad one here, 22nd January
item.description:
Needs urgent please. Can we not have a temporary fix that soon fails? Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chislehurst Road, Petts Wood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constantly dumping of items opposite my flat, 22nd January
item.description:
I have made a previous report where furniture, waste and shelves, rubbish have been continuously dumped opposite my property. People are constantly dumping new items daily and it is becoming abit of a nuisance having to always report this. In addition to this this is also a hygiene and health and safety issue. I am someone who has health issues so this is not fair to have to put up with this or report this regularly. The dumping of items has gotten worse. Something else needs to be done about this as it seems to be continuing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-14, Perryn Road, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sunken road drain, 22nd January
item.description:
Very deeply sunk road drain just after mini roundabout. Sometimes masked by parked van but very dangerous when van not there and travelling along the Avenue from Midfield Way direction. Especially dangerous if forced towards left kerbside by vehicle passing in opposite direction.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 72, The Avenue, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Washing Machine dumped, 22nd January
item.description:
A white washing machine has been fly tipped next to the large blue recycling bins.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): John Wilson Street, Woolwich

item.title: FixMyStreet ref: 8712453, 22nd January
item.description:
A recent report was disregarded as not being to councils’s issue - but this is the council’s issue as the playground is council-run, as shown by the signs at its entrance.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Queensbridge Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Abandoned motorbike, 22nd January
item.description:
Motorbike is abandoned and causing distress as loitering is happening 24/7 by this motorbike. It’s been abandoned for months now and no one has come back to collect.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Portland Avenue, Hackney, London

item.title: Footway obstructed - Leesons Way, 22nd January
item.description:
A hedge has grown extensively and is obstructing the footway alongside Leesons Way, with over half the footway now blocked. This is exacerbated by wet weather. Please could this be cut back?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, Leesons Way, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked kerb-side gulleys, 22nd January
item.description:
In yesterday’s rain all three gulleys outside Nos 5, 15 and 39 Towncourt Crescent were not drawing away. Each gulley was backing up and the water simply flowing over the top of the gulleys. This was not due to the amount of rain which was not that heavy but because each gulley is blocked.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Towncourt Crescent, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole, 22nd January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nant Road, Golders Green, Greater London

item.title: Many potholes all over this section of road., 22nd January
item.description:

item.title: Branches and other mess on pavement and road, 22nd January
item.description:
Reported this a few days ago and had a notice to say this was fixed, but it is not as you can see from my photos. As I have mentioned many times before the street cleans vehicle cannot get down our end of the road so needs to be swept on a regular basis.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leamington Avenue, Sundridge, Greater London

item.title: The road, house Nos. 1-125 in a very poor state., 22nd January
